title: Creep/Minion Denying and Creep Blocking
body:
For those that don't know, denying is last hitting your own minion to 'deny' your enemy laner gold and experience, and creep blocking is 'blocking' your minion wave so it takes longer to get to the lane, so both waves meet closer to your own turret, making it more risky for your enemy to farm and safer for you.

I think denying would be good mechanic to implement because you potentially have more control over the lane if you play correctly, you would be able to freeze/push/reset waves better.

Just curious as to why Riot hasn't implemented the denying mechanic yet.

Then again I'm just a bronzie looooooooooooooooooooool

replies.body: Because it's stupid and unfair to deny your own minions and/or block them. I know you can do it in dota and i've been playing dota for 5 years but i still find it stupid.
How is it stupid and unfair? You haven't stated why it's not beneficial to the game at all.

Cause minions are neutral, you shouldn't be able to contrl them in any way, and deny...are you serious?? Just imagine a bot lane with vayne vs cait, with cait obviously having the upper hand and not only denying cs from vayne by pushing/bullying her but on top  of it denying the minions by hitting them. It's just not fair and not balanced to do something like that cause whoever has the early game can deny ALL the farm frmo the enemy. There is freezing and zoning for that, if you can't do that, don't ask for something more than this.
